metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19203 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.x before 6.9.4_rc2. In the function gb18030_mbc_enc_len in file gb18030.c, a UChar pointer is dereferenced without checking if it passed the end of the matched string. This leads to a heap-based buffer over-read.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libonig2 - 5.9.1-1ubuntu1.1+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libonig package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1-1ubuntu1.1+esm3').
